13183.「……ああ。よ……やく 応えて……らえた。: Ah... ah. Finally... you answered me.

13184.「シーバの鏡とは……２枚ひと組で\n 遠く……はなれた相手と……会話できる\n:
Sheba's Mirror is a magical mirror that allows
you to talk to someone far, far away with a
pair of mirrors.

13185.「あなたは……<pc>さんで…すか。\n レベル３０以上の……魔法使いの方と\n:
Are you...<pc>? I see that you are a
mage... of level 30 or above.

13186.「え…え。この鏡は……それなりの魔力を\n 持った者に……しか 使えな…いのです:
Uh...eh. This mirror... can only be used by
those with a certain amount of magical power.

13187.「ところで……私は ウェ…ナ諸島に\n いるのですが……あなたは ど…こで\n:
By the way I'm in the Wayna Islands and I was
wondering if you could tell me where you can
hear me. ...where do you hear my voice?

13188.「……ほほ…う。港町レンドアの…宿屋で…すか。\n それは すば……らしい！:
...Hoho...u. Inn...in...Port Town Lendor?
That's very speedy!

13189.「港町レンドアと…いうことは 鉄道を使えば\n オ……グリード大…陸の ゲルト海:
Port Town Lendor...which means it's just a
short train ride to Gert...Strait on the
O...greed...Continent...right?

13190.「知りあった…ばかりの あな…たに\n こんなこと頼む…のも 気が引けますが\n:
I know it's a little awkward for me to ask you, who I've only just met, to do something like this, but I have a favor to ask. I've
just met you.

13191.「じつは その ゲルト海峡に出現す…る\n <%sEV_QUE_NAME0>に:
As a matter of fact, if you use Bang to kill the Clockwork Cuckoo that appears in the Gert Strait, it will drop a Magic Stone... It's
true.

13192.「その 魔導の石を 手に入れて……\n もう一度 こ…の鏡に 話しかけて……\n:
Would you take the Magic Stone and speak to
the mirror once more? Can I?

13193.「おお。ありがとうござ…います。\n あなたは すばらし……人だ！:
Oh. Thank you very much. You are a wonderful
person!

13194.「くれぐれも よろし……くお願いします。\n それでは 今日のとこ…ろは \n:
Please take care of me. Well then, I'll leave
you with this... today.

13195.「おお。ありがとうござ…います。\n で…も あなたは たく…さんの\n 頼まれ:
Oh. Thank you very much. So... you have a lot
of Coral's requests.

13196.「しかた……ありませんね。\n この件は また今度……ということで。:
I have no choice...I guess. We'll talk about
this another time.

13197.「そ…うですか。残念……です。\n もし 気が変わ……たら また\n この鏡に:
I see.... I'm sorry. If you change your mind,
please talk to this mirror again.

13337.「そ…れでは その魔導の石を\n 鏡に向か……て かかげて…ください。\n こ…:
Now then, please hold up the Magic Stone to
the mirror. This mirror has a wonderful
ability.

13338.「なんと 鏡自体の大き…さを超えな…モノなら\n 鏡を通し…て 相手側に 送るこ:
If the size of the object... does not exceed the size of the mirror itself... it can be sent through the mirror... to the other side.
Yes!

13339.魔導の石は 光に変わって\n鏡の中に 吸い込まれていった！:
The Magic Stone turned to light and was sucked
into the mirror!

13340.「ちゃん…と 届きまし…たよ。\n それでは こちらか……も 今回のお礼……\n:
I received it. I'll send you a thank you as
well!

13341.「本当……あり……とうござい……た。\n あな……が 親切な……で……かったです:
Thank you very much. You... were... very...
kind.

13342.「あ…れ？ ……を送っ……ら\n 急に……声……れなくな…………したね。:
Ah...what? After I sent... you... suddenly...
stopped... your... voice.

13343.「こ……鏡は……古……から……調子が……。\n これ以……会話……には……。:
This... mirror... has been... in bad shape
since... since... since... we... talked...
about... this... thing.

13344.「……うですね。時が……たら……\n 試し……しょう。……まで\n 鏡の直しか…:
I guess so. When the time...comes...we'll
try...it out. Until then, I'll just look at
the mirror straight on........

13345.「もしか……して 私の お願い…を\n 引き受けてく…れる気に なりました…か？:
Are you... ready... to... accept... my...
request?

26234.「私は……魔法使い…リュナン。\n たまたま この…シーバの鏡を手に入れ……\n:
I am Lunan, the mage. I happened to receive
this... mirror of Sheba... and I speak to
you... behind the mirror.

41528.<pc>は 鏡のある客室に 泊まった。:
<pc> stayed in a guest room with a
mirror.

41530.<pc>は 鏡のある客室に 泊まった。:
<pc> stayed in a guest room with a
mirror.

41531.「おや。あ…なたは <pc>さん？\n ま…た お会いできるとは……\n うれし:
Oy. Ah...are you <pc>?
Well...it's...nice...to meet you...again.

41532.<pc>は 鏡のある客室に 泊まった。:
<pc> stayed in a guest room with a
mirror.

41533.「あ……あ。<pc>さん。\n 約束の……魔導の石を……\n 取ってきて……れた:
Ah...oh. <pc>. I got the
promised...Magic Stone...from you...didn't I?
